text:
Item No* 4
8-10-55
TOs NAEB BOARD OF DIRECTORS ~
FROMs Frank S0 Schooley
RE: Proposed Washington Compact - a nw J G E T
Attached is ”The Washington Compact: An Integrated Approach to
Educational Broadcasting.” This is now being referred for action to
(1) MEB, (2) ACE-TV, (3) the Center, (4) NCCET. and (5) JCET. For all
practical purposes it has already been approved by the Center, ACE, and
NCCET. It carries endorsement of JCET chairmane I recommend approval
by NAEB.
Now a few comments, as document speaks pretty well for itself.
Essentially, this is a policy document. Obviously, some administrative
details remain to be worked out. If adopted, trio working out in first
instance probably becomes Newburn, Jorgensen, and Schooley, as you* 11
note.
This document was arrived at at two different meetings, with
essentially same people present at both. It is, I believe in principle,
what NAEB Board agreed it could agree on. One minor point, our Board
had divided opinion on JCET or JGSB. The ** compact group” had rather
strong feelings on JCET. I did not oppose, but insisted that ^Committee”
be changed to nCouncil,w and that the Washington office was to represent
both the radio and television interests of both NAEB and the Center.
This was agreed upon unanimously.
I shall be glad to answer questions, furnish additional informa¬
tion. Meanwhile, I urge a fast reply from you so I can give an early
NAEB decision. Also, I trust you911 treat this with some confidence
so that we are in no way responsible for rocking the boat.
FES:wc
Enclosure: (1)
cc: Cohn & Marks
Richard B. Hull
